name: 3/4 Sit-Up
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
Place your hands lightly behind your head or across your chest.
Engage your abs to lift your shoulders and upper back off the floor.
Lower yourself back down with control, stopping before your lower back lifts off the floor.
form_cues: Lead with your chest, not your head.
common_mistakes: Pulling on your neck with your hands.
Using momentum instead of abdominal control.
Letting your lower back arch off the floor too much on the descent.
injury_prevention_tips: If you feel any strain in your lower back, reduce your range of motion or place your hands behind you for support.

name: 90/90 Hamstring
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie flat on your back with one leg extended straight on the floor.
Lift your other leg up, keeping the knee bent at 90 degrees.
Gently straighten the lifted leg towards the ceiling until you feel a stretch in the hamstring.
Return to the bent position and repeat.
form_cues: Keep your lower back pressed into the floor.
Stop at the point of a comfortable stretch, not pain.
common_mistakes: Lifting your hips off the floor to chase the stretch.
Jerking the leg straight instead of moving smoothly.
Bending the extended leg on the floor.
injury_prevention_tips: Never force a stretch; if you feel sharp pain, stop immediately.

name: Machine Crunch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on the machine and place your feet under the pads.
Grab the handles and rest your triceps on the pads.
Crunch down by bringing your elbows toward your knees.
Return to the starting position slowly.
common_mistakes: Using your arms to pull instead of your abs to crunch.
Using too much weight, causing you to jerk.
Not controlling the negative (return) portion of the lift.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with a very light weight to master the form first.

name: Adductor
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie face down and place a foam roller under one inner thigh.
Support your weight with your hands and knees.
Slowly roll from your hip down to just above your knee.
Pause for 10-30 seconds on any tight spots.
form_cues: Avoid rolling directly over bony areas.
common_mistakes: Rolling too fast without pausing on tension spots.
Putting too much weight and causing bruising.
Rolling over the knee joint itself.
injury_prevention_tips: If you feel sharp nerve pain, adjust your position or reduce pressure.

name: Adductor/Groin
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back and bring the soles of your feet together, letting your knees fall out to the sides.
If you have a partner, have them gently hold your feet.
Try to squeeze your knees together while your partner resists for 10 seconds.
Relax and let your partner gently push your knees further apart to stretch.
form_cues: Keep your back flat on the floor.
Communicate with your partner about intensity.
common_mistakes: Letting your partner push too hard, causing pain.
Lifting your hips off the floor.
Holding your breath during the contraction.
injury_prevention_tips: Only perform this with a trusted partner who understands how to apply gradual pressure.

name: Air Bike
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with hands lightly behind your head.
Lift your knees to a 90-degree angle and lift your shoulders off the floor.
Bring your right elbow toward your left knee while extending the right leg.
Switch sides in a smooth pedaling motion.
form_cues: Keep your lower back pressed to the floor.
Exhale as you twist to bring elbow to knee.
common_mistakes: Rushing the movement and losing form.
Letting the lower back arch off the floor.
injury_prevention_tips: If your neck gets tired, place one hand behind your head and the other on your stomach.

name: All Fours Quad Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Start on your hands and knees on a comfortable surface.
Shift your weight to one side and grab your opposite foot with your hand.
Gently pull your heel toward your glute.
Hold for 10-20 seconds and switch sides.
form_cues: Squeeze your glute to intensify the stretch.
common_mistakes: Letting the knee flare out to the side.
injury_prevention_tips: Place a mat under your knees for comfort.

name: Alternate Hammer Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing your body.
Curl one dumbbell up toward your shoulder without moving your upper arm.
Lower it down with control.
Repeat with the other arm, alternating sides.
form_cues: Keep your elbows tucked by your sides.
Squeeze at the top of the movement.
common_mistakes: Swinging your body to lift the weight.
Moving your elbows forward or backward.
Dropping the weight quickly on the way down.
injury_prevention_tips: Choose a weight that allows you to maintain strict form.

name: Alternate Heel Touchers
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat.
Crunch your upper body up slightly.
Reach your right hand to touch your right heel.
Return to center and repeat on the left side.
form_cues: Keep your head in line with your spine.
Keep your shoulders lifted throughout the set.
common_mistakes: Lifting your hips off the floor.
injury_prevention_tips: If you can't reach your heel comfortably, just reach as far as your range of motion allows.

name: Alternating Deltoid Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding light dumbbells at your sides.
Raise one arm to the front to shoulder height.
Lower it and then raise the other arm out to the side to shoulder height.
Continue alternating between front and side raises.
form_cues: Keep a slight bend in the elbow.
common_mistakes: Shrugging your shoulders up to your ears.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with very light weights (1-3 lbs) to learn the movement.

name: Alternating Floor Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent.
Hold a kettlebell or dumbbell in each hand at chest level.
Press one weight up until your arm is straight.
Lower it back down and press the other side.
form_cues: Keep your elbows at a 45-degree angle to your body.
common_mistakes: Banging the weight down on your chest.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep your feet flat on the floor to stabilize your spine.

name: Ankle Circles
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding onto a stable object for balance.
Lift one foot slightly off the ground.
Rotate your ankle in a circle, drawing it with your big toe.
Complete the reps on one side before switching.
form_cues: Keep your balance by holding on tight.
common_mistakes: Moving the entire leg instead of just the ankle.
Going too fast and losing control.
injury_prevention_tips: Do this near a wall or sturdy chair to prevent falling.

name: Ankle On The Knee
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet on the floor.
Cross your right ankle over your left knee.
Grab the back of your left thigh and gently pull both legs toward your chest.
Hold for 10-20 seconds and switch sides.
form_cues: Keep your head and shoulders relaxed.
Keep your back flat on the floor.
Pull gently until you feel a stretch.
common_mistakes: Pulling too hard and causing knee pain.
Lifting your hips off the floor.
injury_prevention_tips: If you feel knee pain, stop immediately.

name: Anterior Tibialis-SMR
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on the floor with your legs bent.
Place a foam roller or rolling pin on the muscle outside your shin.
Gently roll from just below the knee to above the ankle.
Pause on any tight spots for 10-30 seconds.
form_cues: Use your hands to support your weight.
common_mistakes: Putting too much body weight on the roller.
injury_prevention_tips: This area is sensitive; use light pressure to start.

name: Arm Circles
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with your arms extended straight out to your sides.
Make small circles with your arms for 10 seconds.
Reverse the direction of the circles.
Keep your core engaged throughout.
form_cues: Keep arms parallel to the floor.
Keep a slight bend in the elbows.
common_mistakes: Making circles that are too large and losing control.
injury_prevention_tips: If you have shoulder pain, reduce the size of the circles.

name: Back Flyes - With Bands
beginner_friendly_instructions: Anchor a resistance band to a sturdy post.
Stand facing away from the post, holding the band handles.
Start with arms extended in front of you.
Pull your arms out to the sides and back, squeezing your shoulder blades.
form_cues: Keep arms straight but not locked.
Squeeze your back muscles at the end of the movement.
common_mistakes: Using too heavy a band and losing form.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure the band is securely anchored before starting.

name: Ball Leg Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with your heels on top of a stability ball.
Lift your hips off the ground.
Roll the ball toward you by bending your knees.
Roll it back out to the starting position.
common_mistakes: Letting hips drop to the floor.
Lifting hips with your glutes instead of hamstrings.
Moving too fast and losing control.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure the ball is the correct size so your knees are at 90 degrees at the top.

name: Band Hip Adductions
beginner_friendly_instructions: Anchor a band to a sturdy post.
Stand sideways to the post with the band around your far ankle.
Keep your leg straight and pull it across your body.
Return to the start slowly.
form_cues: Control the movement on the way back.
common_mistakes: Using momentum to swing the leg.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with a light band to avoid losing balance.

name: Band Pull Apart
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding a resistance band with both hands, arms straight out in front.
Pull the band apart by moving your hands out to the sides.
Squeeze your shoulder blades together.
Return to the start with control.
common_mistakes: Using a band that is too heavy, causing you to round your shoulders forward.
injury_prevention_tips: Focus on posture; this is a great exercise to counteract slouching.

name: Band Skullcrusher
beginner_friendly_instructions: Anchor a band behind you (e.g., under a bench or rack).
Lie down and hold the band ends with hands near your forehead.
Keep elbows pointing to the ceiling and tucked in.
Extend your arms straight up, then lower back down slowly.
form_cues: Keep elbows pointing up, not flaring out.
common_mistakes: Flaring elbows out to the sides.
Using too much weight, causing elbow pain.
injury_prevention_tips: If you feel elbow pain, switch to a lighter band or try a different tricep exercise.

name: Barbell Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding a barbell with an underhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
Keep your elbows pinned to your sides.
Curl the bar up toward your shoulders.
Lower it back down slowly.
form_cues: Squeeze your biceps at the top.
common_mistakes: Swinging your body to lift the weight.
Letting elbows drift forward or backward.
Using a grip that is too wide or too narrow.
injury_prevention_tips: Avoid swinging to protect your lower back and bicep tendons.

name: Barbell Glute Bridge
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on the floor with a padded barbell across your hips.
Lie back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
Drive through your heels to lift your hips toward the ceiling.
Lower your hips back down with control.
form_cues: Squeeze your glutes hard at the top.
common_mistakes: Overextending your lower back (arching too much).
Pushing through toes instead of heels.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a thick pad or towel under the bar to prevent bruising on your hips.

name: Barbell Seated Calf Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench with the balls of your feet on a block or step.
Place a barbell across your upper thighs (near the knees).
Hold the bar in place with your hands.
Raise your heels up as high as possible, then lower slowly.
form_cues: Pause at the top for a squeeze.
common_mistakes: Bouncing at the bottom of the movement.
Moving your knees up and down.
Letting the bar roll off your legs.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure the bar is secure and balanced before starting.

name: Barbell Shrug
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding a barbell in front of your thighs with an overhand grip.
Keep your arms straight and relaxed.
Shrug your shoulders up toward your ears.
Lower them back down slowly.
form_cues: Keep your neck in a neutral position.
common_mistakes: Rolling your shoulders forward or backward.
injury_prevention_tips: Avoid heavy weights initially to prevent neck strain.

name: Barbell Side Bend
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding a barbell behind your neck or resting on your shoulders.
Keep your torso straight.
Bend sideways to the right as far as you can.
Return to center and repeat on the left side.
common_mistakes: Using too much weight, causing loss of balance.
injury_prevention_tips: Start without weight to master the movement pattern first.

name: Behind Head Chest Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on the floor with a partner behind you.
Place your hands behind your head with elbows pointing out.
Have your partner gently hold your elbows while you try to pull them forward (isometric).
Relax, and let your partner slowly pull your elbows back for a stretch.
form_cues: Stop if you feel sharp pain.
common_mistakes: Partner pulling too hard or too fast.
injury_prevention_tips: Never force a stretch past comfort.
Ensure your partner watches your facial cues for discomfort.

name: Bench Dips
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on the edge of a bench and place hands next to hips.
Slide your butt off the bench and walk feet out.
Bend elbows to lower your body, then push back up.
Keep knees bent to make it easier.
injury_prevention_tips: If you feel shoulder pain, stop immediately.
Keep feet close to your body to reduce load.

name: Band Bench Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on a bench with a band looped under your feet.
Hold the band handles at chest level.
Press hands straight up toward the ceiling.
Lower hands slowly back to chest.
common_mistakes: Letting bands pull arms inward (losing tension).
injury_prevention_tips: Check band integrity for tears before use.
Use a stable bench surface.

name: Bent-Knee Hip Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet off the floor.
Pull knees toward your chest using your abs.
Lift hips off the floor and roll pelvis back.
Lower hips back down slowly.
common_mistakes: Letting feet touch the floor during the set.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep movements slow and controlled.
Avoid if you have existing lower back pain.

name: Body Tricep Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Find a bar at chest height (like a Smith machine).
Stand facing away, holding the bar with hands shoulder-width.
Step feet forward and lean your body forward.
Bend elbows to lower chest to bar, then push back up.
common_mistakes: Going too close to the bar (harder)
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure the bar is locked in place.
Don't let your nose crash into the bar.

name: Bodyweight Mid Row
beginner_friendly_instructions: Grab a pull-up bar with an overhand grip.
Lift knees to chest and lean back.
Pull your chest toward the bar using your back.
Lower yourself back down slowly.
form_cues: Keep arms straight at the bottom.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure you can safely hang from the bar.
Don't let go of the bar at the bottom (controlled descent).

name: Bodyweight Squat
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
Sit your hips back and down (like a chair).
Go as low as you can comfortably.
Stand back up by driving through heels.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep your core braced.
Ensure you have adequate ankle mobility.

name: Bodyweight Walking Lunge
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand tall with hands on hips.
Step forward with one leg and lower hips.
Drop back knee toward the ground.
Push off front foot to step into the next lunge.
injury_prevention_tips: Perform on a soft surface if balance is poor.
Don't let the back knee slam into the floor.

name: Brachialis-SMR
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your side with a foam roller under your upper arm.
Support your weight with your hand and feet.
Roll from the elbow toward the shoulder.
Pause on tender spots for 10-30 seconds.
common_mistakes: Rolling directly over the elbow joint.
injury_prevention_tips: Avoid rolling over bone.
Don't spend too long on one spot.

name: Butt-Ups
beginner_friendly_instructions: Start in a forearm plank position.
Arch your lower back slightly.
Squeeze abs to lift hips toward the ceiling.
Lower hips back down slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep tension in the core throughout.
Avoid if you have wrist pain.

name: Butt Lift (Bridge)
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat.
Drive through heels to lift hips up.
Squeeze glutes at the top.
Lower hips back down slowly.
common_mistakes: Pushing through toes instead of heels.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep glutes tight at the top to protect the back.
Ensure feet are hip-width apart.

name: Machine Chest Fly
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on the machine with back against the pad.
Grab the handles with arms slightly bent.
Bring handles together in front of chest.
Return slowly to the start position.
common_mistakes: Opening arms too far back (shoulder strain).
injury_prevention_tips: Don't go past shoulder level.
Control the weight on the way back.

name: Cable Chest Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit between two cable towers.
Hold handles at chest height, elbows bent.
Press handles forward until arms are straight.
Bring handles back slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Choose a weight you can control.
Keep wrists straight.

name: Cable Crunch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Kneel in front of a high cable with a rope attachment.
Hold rope behind your head.
Crunch down, bringing elbows toward knees.
Return up slowly against the weight.
common_mistakes: Pulling with arms instead of abs.
injury_prevention_tips: Pad your knees if the floor is hard.
Keep tension on abs, not lower back.

name: Cable Hammer Curls (Rope Attachment)
beginner_friendly_instructions: Attach rope to a low cable.
Stand straight and hold rope with neutral grip.
Curl rope up toward shoulders.
Lower rope slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep upper arms glued to your sides.
Don't drop the weight suddenly.

name: Cable Hip Adduction
beginner_friendly_instructions: Attach ankle cuff to low cable.
Stand sideways to the machine.
Grab the machine for balance.
Pull working leg across the standing leg.
common_mistakes: Using hip flexor instead of adductor.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with light weight.
Ensure ankle cuff is secure.

name: Cable Internal Rotation
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit next to a low cable.
Hold handle with elbow bent 90 degrees.
Keep elbow tucked into your side.
Rotate forearm across your stomach.
injury_prevention_tips: Warm up shoulders first.
Avoid if you have rotator cuff pain.

name: Cable Preacher Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit at a preacher bench facing a low cable.
Hold the bar attachment with arms extended.
Curl the bar up toward shoulders.
Lower the bar slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Don't hyperextend elbows at the bottom.
Use a light weight to start.

name: Cable Rear Delt Fly
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set cables above head height.
Cross arms in front of you.
Pull arms back and out to the sides.
Return arms forward slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Don't let the weight slam back.
Keep wrists neutral.

name: Cable Rope Rear-Delt Rows
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit at a low row machine with a rope.
Lean back slightly, arms extended.
Pull rope to upper chest, elbows wide.
Return arms forward slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep neck neutral.
Don't jerk the weight.

name: Cable Seated Crunch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench facing away from a high cable.
Hold rope behind head.
Crunch down, bringing elbows to knees.
Return up slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Pad knees if needed.
Keep tension on abs.

name: Cable Seated Lateral Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench between two low cables.
Cross arms in front of you.
Raise arms to the sides until parallel to floor.
Lower arms slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Don't go too heavy.
Keep wrists neutral.

name: Cable Shoulder Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set cables to bottom position.
Stand between towers, hold handles at shoulders.
Press handles straight overhead.
Lower handles back to shoulders.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep core braced.
Don't lock elbows out hard.

name: Cable Shrugs
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold a cable bar attached to a low pulley.
Stand tall with arms straight down.
Shrug shoulders up to ears.
Lower shoulders back down.
form_cues: Hold at the top for 1 second.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep chin tucked slightly.
Don't jerk the weight.

name: Cable Wrist Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench, hold cable bar with palms up.
Rest forearms on thighs, wrists hanging off.
Curl wrists up toward you.
Lower wrists back down slowly.
common_mistakes: Dropping the weight at the bottom.
injury_prevention_tips: Start light to avoid wrist strain.
Don't hyperextend wrists.

name: Calf-Machine Shoulder Shrug
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand inside the machine with the pads resting on your shoulders.
Keep your chest up and arms straight at your sides.
Shrug your shoulders straight up toward your ears.
Lower slowly back to the start.
common_mistakes: Rolling shoulders forward or backward instead of moving straight up and down.
Using too much weight and swinging the torso.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep your neck in a neutral position; don't crane it forward.

name: Calf Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit in the machine and adjust the seat so your knees are slightly bent.
Place the balls of your feet on the lower part of the platform.
Push down through your toes to lift the weight, extending your ankles.
Lower the weight slowly until you feel a stretch.
common_mistakes: Moving knees instead of just ankles.
injury_prevention_tips: Don't lock your knees hard at the top; keep a slight bend.

name: Calf Press On The Leg Press Machine
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on the leg press and place your feet on the platform with heels hanging off.
Press the platform up until legs are straight (do not lock knees).
Push through the balls of your feet to raise your heels high.
Lower heels slowly below the platform for a stretch.
common_mistakes: Moving knees up and down instead of keeping them still.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep safety bars engaged if available.

name: Calf Raise On A Dumbbell
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold a sturdy object for balance.
Stand on a single dumbbell with the balls of your feet.
Raise your heels by pressing up on your toes.
Lower slowly to stretch the calves.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a stable surface to hold onto.
Start with light weight to master balance.

name: Calf Raises - With Bands
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand on the middle of a resistance band.
Hold the handles at shoulder height with palms forward.
Press up onto your toes, lifting heels high.
Lower heels slowly to feel tension.
common_mistakes: Standing on the ends of the band (causes slipping).
injury_prevention_tips: Check that the band is not frayed before use.

name: Calf Stretch Elbows Against Wall
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand facing a wall, about arm's length away.
Place your forearms on the wall.
Step one foot back, keeping the heel flat.
Lean forward gently until you feel a stretch.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep hips facing forward.

name: Calf Stretch Hands Against Wall
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand facing a wall, about arm's length away.
Step one foot back, keeping the heel flat.
Place hands on the wall and lean forward.
Keep your back straight and hips forward.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep the back leg straight but not locked.

name: Calves-SMR
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on the floor with legs extended.
Place a foam roller under your lower leg.
Lift hips slightly to add pressure.
Roll slowly from knee to ankle.
common_mistakes: Rolling directly over the knee or ankle joint.
injury_prevention_tips: Avoid rolling over bones; focus on muscle.

name: Cat Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Get on hands and knees.
Inhale and drop your belly slightly.
Exhale and round your spine up toward the ceiling.
Drop your head and hold.
injury_prevention_tips: Move slowly and smoothly.

name: Chair Leg Extended Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit upright in a chair.
Extend one leg straight out in front.
Flex your foot (toes up).
Hold gently, then switch legs.
injury_prevention_tips: Only extend to a mild stretch.

name: Chair Lower Back Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit tall in a chair.
Reach one arm over your head to the opposite side.
Gently lean until you feel a stretch.
Hold, then switch sides.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep shoulders relaxed.

name: Chair Squat
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand in front of a chair with feet shoulder-width.
Push hips back and bend knees to lower to the chair.
Lightly tap the seat (don't fully sit).
Stand back up by driving through heels.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a higher chair if mobility is limited.

name: Chair Upper Body Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on the edge of a chair.
Grip the back of the chair with both hands.
Straighten arms and gently lean forward.
Hold and breathe.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep wrists neutral.

name: Chest And Front Of Shoulder Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold a stick or broomstick with a wide grip.
Raise it overhead and behind your head.
Keep arms straight.
Stop when you feel a stretch in the chest.
injury_prevention_tips: Do not force the stick behind your head if it hurts.

name: Chest Stretch on Stability Ball
beginner_friendly_instructions: Kneel next to a stability ball.
Place one elbow on the ball.
Gently lower your chest toward the floor.
Hold, then switch sides.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep the shoulder away from the ear.

name: Child's Pose
beginner_friendly_instructions: Start on hands and knees.
Sit your hips back toward your heels.
Extend arms forward and lower chest.
Rest forehead on the floor.
injury_prevention_tips: Place a cushion under knees or ankles if sensitive.

name: Chin To Chest Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit tall with a straight back.
Place hands behind your head.
Gently lower chin toward chest.
Hold and breathe.
injury_prevention_tips: Move slowly to avoid neck strain.

name: Close-Grip EZ Bar Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold an EZ bar with a close grip (hands inside shoulder width).
Stand tall with elbows tucked at your sides.
Curl the bar up toward shoulders.
Lower slowly to full extension.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep wrists neutral to avoid strain.

name: Close-Grip Front Lat Pulldown
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit at the lat pulldown with a close grip.
Pull the bar down to your upper chest.
Squeeze shoulder blades together.
Return slowly to the start.
common_mistakes: Yanking the bar behind the neck.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep the movement controlled; avoid momentum.

name: Close-Grip Standing Barbell Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold a barbell with hands shoulder-width or slightly inside.
Stand tall with elbows pinned to your sides.
Curl the bar up to shoulder height.
Lower slowly to full extension.
common_mistakes: Using hips to swing the weight.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep wrists neutral.

name: Concentration Curls
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench, hold a dumbbell in one hand.
Place the back of your upper arm against your inner thigh.
Curl the dumbbell up toward your shoulder.
Lower slowly and repeat on the other side.
common_mistakes: Lifting the elbow off the thigh.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a lighter weight to focus on form.

name: Cross-Body Crunch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat.
Place hands behind your head.
Bring right elbow toward left knee while lifting left knee.
Alternate sides with each rep.
common_mistakes: Moving only the elbows without torso rotation.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep neck neutral; don't yank head forward.

name: Cross Body Hammer Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding dumbbells with palms facing in.
Curl the right dumbbell toward your left shoulder.
Lower and repeat on the other side.
Keep elbows close to your body.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep wrists neutral.

name: Crunch - Hands Overhead
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat.
Reach arms overhead with palms crossed.
Curl your chest toward your hips.
Lower slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep chin slightly tucked.

name: Crunches
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat.
Place hands lightly by your head (don't lock fingers).
Press lower back into the floor.
Lift shoulder blades a few inches, then lower.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep elbows wide and relaxed.

name: Dancer's Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on the floor with your right leg crossed over your left, keeping the right knee bent.
Keep your left leg straight and flat on the floor.
Place your left elbow on your right knee and your right hand on the floor for support.
Gently rotate your upper body to the right until you feel a stretch. Hold, then switch sides.
common_mistakes: Hunching the back instead of rotating through the spine.
Using too much force and bouncing.
injury_prevention_tips: Focus on a smooth rotation rather than forcing the twist.
Keep the supporting leg straight to stabilize the hip.

name: Dead Bug
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with arms extended toward the ceiling and knees bent at 90 degrees.
Exhale hard to press your lower back flat against the floor.
Slowly lower one leg toward the floor while keeping your back flat.
Return to the start and repeat on the other side.
common_mistakes: Letting your lower back arch off the floor.
Moving too fast and losing control.
injury_prevention_tips: If your back arches, don't lower your leg as far.
Keep your ribcage down to prevent flaring.

name: Decline Crunch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Secure your legs on a decline bench and lie back.
Place hands lightly by your head, elbows wide.
Press your lower back into the bench and lift your shoulders slightly.
Squeeze your abs at the top, then lower slowly.
common_mistakes: Pulling on your neck with your hands.
Using momentum to lift your shoulders.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep a tennis ball's space between your chin and chest.
Stop if you feel strain in your lower back.

name: Decline Oblique Crunch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Secure your legs on a decline bench and lie back.
Place one hand behind your head and the other on your thigh.
Crunch up and rotate your torso to bring your elbow toward the opposite knee.
Lower slowly and complete all reps on one side before switching.
common_mistakes: Yanking your neck to force the twist.
Moving your hips side to side.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep the movement controlled to protect the spine.
Use a lighter weight if available to focus on form.

name: Decline Reverse Crunch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back on a decline bench and hold the top for support.
Lift your legs until they are parallel to the floor.
Curl your hips up toward your chest, lifting your butt off the bench.
Lower your hips back down with control.
common_mistakes: Swinging your legs to create momentum.
Letting your hips drop too quickly.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep a slight bend in the knees to reduce hip flexor strain.
Move slowly to keep tension on the abs.

name: Machine Dips
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit in the dip machine and grip the handles.
Keep your elbows tucked in close to your sides.
Push the handles down until your arms are straight.
Return to the starting position slowly.
common_mistakes: Locking elbows hard at the bottom.
injury_prevention_tips: Don't let your shoulders shrug up.
Keep a slight bend in your elbows at the bottom.

name: Dumbbell Alternate Bicep Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding dumbbells at your sides, palms facing forward.
Curl one dumbbell up toward your shoulder while keeping your elbow stationary.
Squeeze your bicep at the top, then lower slowly.
Alternate arms for each rep.
common_mistakes: Lifting the elbow away from the body.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a weight you can control without rocking your torso.
Keep your wrists straight.

name: Dumbbell Bench Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on a flat bench with dumbbells at your chest, palms forward.
Press the dumbbells straight up until your arms are extended.
Squeeze your chest at the top.
Lower the weights slowly back to the start.
common_mistakes: Flaring elbows to 90 degrees (keep them at ~45).
Bouncing the weights off your chest.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep your shoulder blades pulled together and down.
Don't fully lock out your elbows.

name: Dumbbell Bench Press with Neutral Grip
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on a flat bench holding dumbbells with palms facing each other.
Press the weights straight up over your chest.
Squeeze your chest at the top.
Lower slowly until the dumbbells are near your ribs.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep wrists neutral to protect joints.
Shoulder blades should stay retracted.

name: Dumbbell Bicep Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding dumbbells at your sides, palms facing forward.
Curl both dumbbells up toward your shoulders.
Squeeze your biceps at the top.
Lower the weights slowly back to the start.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep your upper arms vertical and stationary.
Use a weight that allows strict form.

name: Dumbbell Incline Row
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lean your chest against an incline bench, holding dumbbells with arms straight down.
Pull the dumbbells up toward your hips by bending your elbows.
Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top.
Lower slowly to the start.
common_mistakes: Pulling with your arms instead of your back.
Lifting your chest off the bench.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep your neck neutral.
Don't jerk the weight up.

name: Dumbbell Lunges
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding dumbbells at your sides.
Step one foot forward and lower your hips until both knees are bent at 90 degrees.
Keep your front knee behind your toes.
Push back up to the start and switch legs.
injury_prevention_tips: Don't let your front knee go past your toes.
Keep your core braced.

name: Dumbbell Lying Pronation
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie face down on a bench with one arm hanging down, holding a light dumbbell.
Bend your elbow to 90 degrees with your upper arm parallel to the floor.
Rotate your forearm up until it's parallel to the floor.
Lower slowly back down.
injury_prevention_tips: Start very light to protect the elbow.
Move smoothly, no jerking.

name: Dumbbell Lying Supination
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your side on a bench with one arm hanging down, holding a light dumbbell.
Bend your elbow to 90 degrees with your upper arm parallel to the floor.
Rotate your forearm up toward the ceiling until vertical.
Lower slowly back down.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a very light weight.
Keep the movement controlled.

name: Dumbbell Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding dumbbells at your sides, palms facing back.
Raise your arms out to the sides until they reach shoulder height.
Pause briefly at the top.
Lower slowly back down.
common_mistakes: Using momentum to swing the weight.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep a slight bend in your elbows.
Don't shrug your shoulders.

name: Dumbbell Rear Lunge
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding dumbbells at your sides.
Step one foot backward and lower your hips until both knees are bent at 90 degrees.
Keep your torso upright and front shin vertical.
Push back up to the start and switch legs.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep your core tight.
Ensure your front knee doesn't go past your toes.

name: Dumbbell Scaption
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding light dumbbells at your sides, thumbs pointing up.
Raise your arms forward and slightly out to the side at a 30-degree angle.
Stop when your arms are parallel to the floor.
Lower slowly back down.
injury_prevention_tips: Use very light weights.
Keep shoulders down, not shrugged.

name: Dumbbell Seated One-Leg Calf Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench with one foot on a block and a dumbbell on your thigh.
Lower your heel as far as you can to stretch the calf.
Raise your toes up high to contract the calf.
Complete reps on one leg, then switch.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep your foot straight ahead.
Don't rush the stretch.

name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench with back support, dumbbells at shoulder height.
Press the dumbbells straight up until your arms are extended.
Squeeze your shoulders at the top.
Lower slowly back to shoulder height.
common_mistakes: Banging dumbbells together at the top.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep your core braced.
Don't fully lock out your elbows.

name: Dumbbell Shrug
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding dumbbells at your sides, palms facing your body.
Shrug your shoulders up toward your ears.
Hold the squeeze at the top for a second.
Lower slowly back down.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep your neck neutral.
Avoid jerky movements.

name: Dumbbell Side Bend
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding a dumbbell in one hand, other hand on hip.
Bend sideways at the waist toward the weighted side.
Keep your torso straight and don't lean forward.
Return to the start and complete reps on one side, then switch.
common_mistakes: Using too much weight and twisting.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep your core engaged.
Avoid over-stretching at the bottom.

name: Dumbbell Squat
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold dumbbells at your sides, feet shoulder-width apart.
Sit your hips back and down until your thighs are parallel to the floor.
Keep your chest up and back straight.
Push through your heels to stand back up.
common_mistakes: Lifting your heels off the floor.
injury_prevention_tips: Don't let your knees go past your toes.
Keep your core braced throughout.

name: Dumbbell Squat To A Bench
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold dumbbells at your sides with a bench behind you.
Sit your hips back and down until you lightly touch the bench.
Keep your chest up and back straight.
Stand back up without sitting fully on the bench.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a stable bench.
Keep your weight in your heels.

name: Dumbbell Step Ups
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold dumbbells at your sides and stand facing a step or bench.
Place one foot fully on the step.
Push through that heel to lift your body up onto the step.
Step back down and repeat on the same leg before switching.
injury_prevention_tips: Make sure the step is stable.
Keep your knee aligned with your foot.

name: Dynamic Back Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
Swing your straight arms up in front of you.
Gradually increase the height of the swing with each rep.
Continue for 5-10 swings until your arms are overhead.
injury_prevention_tips: Move within a comfortable range.
Don't force the stretch.
